refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis:
for element = source, instruction ; .. ; instruction; end
for element = source instruction .. instruction end
for element = source do instruction, .. instruction end

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If source is an array (homogeneous or not), element is set to each of its columns (for a hypermatrix, as matrix(source, size(source,1), -1))), one by one.
A particular case uses the colon operator to create regularly spaced row vectors, and is similar to traditional for loop forms: for element = n1:step:n2, ...,end
If source is a list, element takes as values the successive entries of the list.
According to the Code Conventions for the Scilab Programming Language it is recommended:

listitem.para: Start each statement on a new line.
Write no more than one simple statement per line.
Break compound statements over multiple lines.

refsection.warning: The number of characters used to define the body of any loop or conditional instruction (if while for or select/case) must be limited to 16 kB.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.para: Trivial iterations (over columns of a row vector):
refsection.programlisting:
for i = [2 4 5] factorial(i) end
// By decreasing values: for j = 4:-1:1 j end
refsection.para: Iterate on the columns of a matrix:
refsection.programlisting: M = [1 2 ; 3 4 ; 5 6]' for c = M, c, end
refsection.para: Iterate on the columns of a cells array :
refsection.programlisting: C = {%pi, "This is πι" ; %z^2, %t} for c = C, c, end
refsection.screen:
--> C = {%pi, "This is πι" ; %z^2, %t} C = [1x1 constant ] [1x1 string ] [1x1 polynomial] [1x1 boolean]
--> for c = C, c, end c = [1x1 constant ] [1x1 polynomial]
c = [1x1 string ] [1x1 boolean]
refsection.para: Loop on the elements of a list:
refsection.screen:
--> for l = list([1 2;3 4], (1+%z)^3, 'example', [%F %T]); l, end l = 1. 2. 3. 4.
l = 2 3 1 +3z +3z +z
l = example
l = F T

revision.revdescription: The source can be a hypermatrix. It is then processed by column as matrix(source, size(source,1), -1).
